name: Brier Island Lodge & Welcome Aboard Whale Watching Tours

reviews.text: The Lodge is attractive with a great view of the Passage and nearby village of Westport. Our room was pleasant and relatively spacious; very nice bathroom. However, it wasn't ready for us until an hour after our check-in time, and we had to return twice before being finally given the key.
reviews.title: not bad but some provisos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be warned if you're a light sleeper: the walls are thin and the building not terribly well-made, since a door shut hard on the floor below made my chair tremble, one floor up and on the opposite side of the room.
reviews.title: Beautiful place!

reviews.text: But the worst was yet to come: we had booked the Family Whale Watch Package, where the hotel was supposed to arrange for 4 tickets on the island's best whale watch cruise. The hotel never made the booking. Only because 3 people didn't turn up for the cruise were my children and I able to go (and only then because my husband stayed behind on shore and missed a great experience).
reviews.title: Wishing I could live there :) Amazing place for nature and escape

likes.liked: — Peaceful... the jacuzzi was a treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we returned to the hotel later, I was greeted with effusive apologies but had to request that they refund my husband's portion of the whale watch cost.
reviews.title: One of the high points of our Nova Scotia visit

likes.disliked: — Who can complain about anything when you are in such a great location.

reviews.text: Briar Island Lodge is a beautiful place on a hill overlooking the ocean on remote Briar Island. Great whale watching and hiking. Rooms were simple but really nice and very clean. Staff great (especially the waitresses in the dining room). The food was really terrific (especially the periwinkles and fish cakes).
reviews.title: You have to visit here ...

likes.liked: — Location location location. Price for value. Nice folks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Brier Island Lodge for 2 nights in July 2007. We originally booked a king size room and when we arrived we were told that due to a plumbing problem in the room we had booked we had been upgraded to a "whirlpool" room. The whirlpool bath is actually in the room (not the bathroom). If you do not intend to use a whirlpool I suggest to request a room that is not next door to one of these due to the noise they make (we didn't make use of it but next door obviously did).
reviews.title: Ideal base for whale watching

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge is generally a little tired and in need of an update but is adequate for 2 nights. We had breakfast and evening meal in the restaurant both days. There is little (if any) choice of places to eat on the island and there is limited choice on the menu especially if you are staying longer than 2 nights.
reviews.title: A Real 'Experience'

likes.liked: — The position, the views, the dining room,
likes.disliked: — Would have liked a small fridge in the room

reviews.text: It is an ideal base for whale watching which seems to be the main reason people visit Brier Island. The standard double/ queen size rooms seem reasonably priced at approx CAD$70 however the more expensive ones at CAD$120 - 140 don't seem worth the extra cost.
reviews.title: Loved the Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had looked forward to our 2 day stay at Brier Island Lodge for many months and when we arrived we were not disappointed. It was everything we hoped it would be.
reviews.title: Great Lodge, Great Value!
Great views!
reviews.text: Brier Island Lodge and the journey to get there is definitely an 'experience' and for this reason, I have marked it 4 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Brier Island Lodge. Staff was very friendly & the room was very spacious. We stayed in a corner room on the second floor & had a wonderful view. Only ate the continental breakfast so cannot really comment on the restaurant.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was simple, spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was accommodating and laid back. Our real praise goes to the Lodge's chef, who offered amazing meals well-beyond expectations, full of local seafood and meat and vegetables from the Annapolis Valley.
reviews.title: magical brier island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented bikes (serviceable clunkers) at the Lodge and explored most of the paved and unpaved primary roads on the island during one day of our two-day stay. The fog, which shrouded most of our time on the island lifted long enough for a sunny lunch and, later, a spectacular sunset.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night on Brier Island to hike and go whale watching. Smaller (and cheaper) room was basic, but had a nice view of the water and Long Island across the way and had a pleasant rustic feel to it with the log walls. Restaurant was unfortunately not open yet in early June for dinner, and options are limited to a small cafe in town or a restaurant a ferry ride away in Long Island. Breakfast (included) was continental, basic but with really good freshly baked scones and cinnamon buns - only suggested thing to add would be some boiled eggs to make it complete. Lodge is located on a hill, adjacent to a nature trail. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: simply superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I live in Toronto, we are software designers - and we just made it through a pressure period of work and activity that left us exhausted. in short, we needed a vacation, a place of tranquillity to ease our urban brains. Our previous journeys to the east never ventured past Montreal, so I was excited at the concept of being on the bay of Fundy, on a quaint island, escaping the smoggy city heat for fresh oceanic air, but I had no idea just how beautiful the whole experience would be... wow. the scenery is potent, stunning, and the service outstanding. first of all, the journey to Brier Island is stellar and by the time you arrive you're all ready in a new state. the view of the bay from the restaurant set the charm every morning over a health savvy breakfast. With whale watching came the raw embrace of nature, with the beach hikes came the privacy - and with the privacy came the romance. My wife and I highly recommend this get away - we have all ready booked our next stay where our new baby (our first) will join us.
reviews.title: Wont ever return!

reviews.text: The resort is situated on a hill overlooking Westport and the water passage between the islands the view is breath taking. We stayed in the newer part, the room was very nice and clean however the walls are rather thin . If you go stay on the upper floor, the ceiling is also very thin and noisy. The staff are friendly and the kids loved the animals on the hobby farm. All in all a good place to stay considering you are 2 islands removed from the mainland.
reviews.title: Great Location
If You Love the Sea, This is the Place to Be. Nature Lovers Paradise
reviews.text: Fantastic, Rustic, fairly Remote little Island. If you want glitz and glamour or shopping,.... Don't come here!!!! If you love nature, hiking, kayaking, whale watching, bird watching and beautiful scenery. This is a little slice of heaven. You can reach the island by driving, about an hour from Digby...out through Digby Neck and Long Island there are two small car ferry's at a cost of $4. each. This covers round trip crossings. They run every half hour. Whale watching from the island is spectacular. One of the best areas I have been for whale watching tours.

Brier Island Lodge itself, is located high up on a cliff overlooking the Bay of Funday The view is stellar....Glorious sunrises ans sunsets. Unless, of course you get fogged in. Then you can't see your hand in front of your face. Staff at the lodge are knowledgeable and friendly. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Service is good. The dining room has excellent food. Especially if you like seafood! If you don't like seafood the menu is limited, but all meals are well prepared and very tasty. The fresh tomato salad, is to die for! Remember this is a very small Island. The lodge is rustic but a nice place to stay. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The Brier Island Lodge is at the end of the world, it seems, as it takes two ferry rides to get there. It is the only choice on the island for hotel/motel style accomodations, if you don't like hostels or B&Bs.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay and eat in a wonderful location

reviews.text: We stayed in the lodge's newer section, which is farthest from the restaurant. It was a comfortable crash, as we got there quite late. The only reason we came to Brier Island was for the whale watching, but when we got there, we wished we had alotted more time for exploring the island. There is lots to do, and the people are friendly.
reviews.title: Worth the two ferry rides...

description: Brier Island Lodge offers 40 clean, comfortable rooms, most with an ocean/lighthouse view, along with a unique Nova Scotia regional dining experience and whale watching boat tours. Brier Island is famous for some of the best whale watching in the world, miles of coastal hiking trails, exceptional birdwatching, seal spotting, rock hounding, sand beach, traditional fishing village and three working lighthouses. A true maritime ecological paradise.
